15.77. Elements a, b of a group G are said to be symmetric with respect to an element g ∈G if a = gb−1g. Let G be an infinite abelian group, α a cardinal, α < |G|. Is it true that for any n-colouring χ : G →{0, 1, . . . , n −1} there exists a monochrome subset of cardinality α that is symmetric with respect to some element of G? This is known to be true for n ⩽3.
I. V. Protasov
